s.text: Adolescence of any kind is risky territory for the "young adult" book writer, perhaps especially in the United States at the present time.
This flexible, realistic moral sense coexists with reassurances that the important moral categories are, in the end, stable.
And let's not forget that Harry has, at the end of Prisoner of Azkaban , just turned 13.
How will Rowlings handle the dark magic of sexuality?
It seems to me that Harry's final confrontation with the dark forces will have to involve his overcoming the temptation to join them.
Adolescence of any kind is risky territory for the "young adult" book writer, perhaps especially in the United States at the present time.
